official-title.#text:
To require the Secretary of Defense to allow civilian
		  employees of the Department of Defense to delay furloughs until returning from
		  a deployment in support of accounting and recovery efforts by the Joint POW/MIA
		  Accounting Command.

cosponsor.#text: Mr. Danny K. Davis of Illinois

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
POW/MIA Accounting and Recovery
			 Support Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall require that, with respect to a civilian employee of the

who is required to take a furlough that would otherwise
			 occur during the deployment of that employee in support of accounting and
			 recovery efforts by the Joint POW/MIA Accounting Command, the employee may take
			 the furlough after returning from the deployment.

header.#text:
Exception to civilian
			 furlough requirements for Department of Defense employees deployed in support
			 of Joint POW/MIA Accounting Command accounting and recovery
			 efforts

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 1520 IH: POW/MIA Accounting and Recovery Support Act of 2013
